segment.source: Oscdimg is a command-line tool that you can use to create an image (.iso) file of a customized 32-bit or 64-bit version of Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE).
segment.target: Oscdimg is a command-line tool that you can use to create an image (.iso) file of a customized 32-bit or 64-bit version of Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE).

segment.source: You can then burn the .iso file to a CD or DVD.
segment.target: You can then burn the .iso file to a CD or DVD.

segment.source: Oscdimg supports ISO 9660, Joliet, and Universal Disk Format (UDF) file systems.
segment.target: Oscdimg supports ISO 9660, Joliet, and Universal Disk Format (UDF) file systems.

segment.source: The following command-line options are available for Oscdimg.
segment.target: The following command-line options are available for Oscdimg.

segment.source: The Oscdimg tool and Microsoft Windows image mastering API (IMAPI) support three file system formats: ISO 9660, Joliet, and UDF.
segment.target: The Oscdimg tool and Microsoft Windows image mastering API (IMAPI) support three file system formats: ISO 9660, Joliet, and UDF.

segment.source: ISO 9660 options cannot be combined with Joliet or UDF options.
segment.target: ISO 9660 options cannot be combined with Joliet or UDF options.

segment.source: The length of the file name combined with the length of the file name extension cannot exceed 30 characters in the ISO 9660 file system.
segment.target: The length of the file name combined with the length of the file name extension cannot exceed 30 characters in the ISO 9660 file system.

segment.source: The -d and -nt options cannot be used together.
segment.target: The -d and -nt options cannot be used together.

segment.source: Does not force lowercase file names to upper case.
segment.target: Does not force lowercase file names to upper case.

segment.source: Permits file names longer than DOS 8.3 file names.
segment.target: Permits file names longer than DOS 8.3 file names.

segment.source: Permits long file names that are compatible with Windows NT 3.51.
segment.target: Permits long file names that are compatible with Windows NT 3.51.

segment.source: Joliet is an extension of the ISO 9660 file system.
segment.target: Joliet is an extension of the ISO 9660 file system.

segment.source: Joliet allows longer file names, Unicode characters, and directory depths larger than eight.
segment.target: Joliet allows longer file names, Unicode characters, and directory depths larger than eight.

segment.source: Joliet options cannot be combined with ISO 9660 options.
segment.target: Joliet options cannot be combined with ISO 9660 options.

segment.source: The -j2 Joliet option cannot be used with any UDF options.
segment.target: The -j2 Joliet option cannot be used with any UDF options.

segment.source: Permits both file systems to view all the data on the disk.
segment.target: Permits both file systems to view all the data on the disk.

segment.source: Using this option does not duplicate all files on the image.
segment.target: Using this option does not duplicate all files on the image.

segment.source: This option encodes Joliet Unicode file names and generates DOS-compatible 8.3 file names in the ISO 9660 namespace.
segment.target: This option encodes Joliet Unicode file names and generates DOS-compatible 8.3 file names in the ISO 9660 namespace.

segment.source: These file names can be read by either Joliet systems or conventional ISO 9660 systems.
segment.target: These file names can be read by either Joliet systems or conventional ISO 9660 systems.

segment.source: However, Oscdimg may change some of the file names in the ISO 9660 namespace to comply with DOS 8.3 and ISO 9660 naming restrictions.
segment.target: However, Oscdimg may change some of the file names in the ISO 9660 namespace to comply with DOS 8.3 and ISO 9660 naming restrictions.

segment.source: Encodes Joliet Unicode file names without standard ISO 9660 names.
segment.target: Encodes Joliet Unicode file names without standard ISO 9660 names.

segment.source: This option is used to produce an image that contains only the Joliet file system.
segment.target: This option is used to produce an image that contains only the Joliet file system.

segment.source: Any system that cannot read Joliet sees only a default text file that alerts the user that this image is only available on computers that support Joliet.
segment.target: Any system that cannot read Joliet sees only a default text file that alerts the user that this image is only available on computers that support Joliet.

segment.source: Overrides the default text file that is used when the user specifies the -j2 option.
segment.target: Overrides the default text file that is used when the user specifies the -j2 option.

segment.source: UDF options cannot be combined with ISO 9660 options.
segment.target: UDF options cannot be combined with ISO 9660 options.

segment.source: The -ue, -uf, and -us options only apply when they are used together with the -u2 option.
segment.target: The -ue, -uf, and -us options only apply when they are used together with the -u2 option.

segment.source: Produces an image that has both the UDF file system and the ISO 9660 file system.
segment.target: Produces an image that has both the UDF file system and the ISO 9660 file system.

segment.source: The ISO 9660 file system is written by using DOS-compatible 8.3 file names.
segment.target: The ISO 9660 file system is written by using DOS-compatible 8.3 file names.

segment.source: The UDF file system is written by using Unicode file names.
segment.target: The UDF file system is written by using Unicode file names.

segment.source: Produces an image that contains only the UDF file system.
segment.target: Produces an image that contains only the UDF file system.

segment.source: Any system that cannot read UDF sees only a default text file that alerts the user that this image is only available on computers that support UDF.
segment.target: Any system that cannot read UDF sees only a default text file that alerts the user that this image is only available on computers that support UDF.

segment.source: Overrides the default text file that is used together with the -u2 option.
segment.target: Overrides the default text file that is used together with the -u2 option.

segment.source: Creates sparse files, when available, to make disk space usage more efficient.
segment.target: Creates sparse files, when available, to make disk space usage more efficient.

segment.source: Specifies long allocation descriptors instead of short allocation descriptors.
segment.target: Specifies long allocation descriptors instead of short allocation descriptors.

segment.source: Boot options can be used to create bootable CD or DVD images.
segment.target: Boot options can be used to create bootable CD or DVD images.

segment.source: The following boot options can be used to generate single-boot entries.
segment.target: The following boot options can be used to generate single-boot entries.

segment.source: For more information, see Use a single boot entry to create a bootable image.
segment.target: For more information, see Use a single boot entry to create a bootable image.

segment.source: Specifies the El Torito boot sector file that will be written in the boot sector or sectors of the disk.
segment.target: Specifies the El Torito boot sector file that will be written in the boot sector or sectors of the disk.

segment.source: Disables floppy disk emulation in the El Torito catalog.
segment.target: Disables floppy disk emulation in the El Torito catalog.

segment.source: Specifies the value to use for the platform ID in the El Torito catalog.
segment.target: Specifies the value to use for the platform ID in the El Torito catalog.

segment.source: The default ID is 0xEF to represent a Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) system.
segment.target: The default ID is 0xEF to represent a Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) system.

segment.source: Specifies the location of the files that you intend to build into an .iso image.
segment.target: Specifies the location of the files that you intend to build into an .iso image.

segment.source: Specifies the name of the .iso image file.
segment.target: Specifies the name of the .iso image file.

segment.source: Single-boot entries and multi-boot entries cannot be combined in the same command.
segment.target: Single-boot entries and multi-boot entries cannot be combined in the same command.

segment.source: The following boot options can be used to generate multi-boot entries.
segment.target: The following boot options can be used to generate multi-boot entries.

segment.source: For more information, see Use multi-boot entries to create an image file.
segment.target: For more information, see Use multi-boot entries to create an image file.

segment.source: Specifies the El Torito boot sector file that will be written in the boot sector or sectors of the disk.
segment.target: Specifies the El Torito boot sector file that will be written in the boot sector or sectors of the disk.

segment.source: Specifies a multi-boot image, followed by the number of boot entries.
segment.target: Specifies a multi-boot image, followed by the number of boot entries.

segment.source: where 3 is the number of boot entries that follow.
segment.target: where 3 is the number of boot entries that follow.

segment.source: Disables floppy disk emulation in the El Torito catalog.
segment.target: Disables floppy disk emulation in the El Torito catalog.

segment.source: Specifies the value to use for the platform ID in the El Torito catalog.
segment.target: Specifies the value to use for the platform ID in the El Torito catalog.

segment.source: The default ID is 0xEF to represent a UEFI system.
segment.target: The default ID is 0xEF to represent a UEFI system.

segment.source: Specifies the El Torito load segment.
segment.target: Specifies the El Torito load segment.

segment.source: If not specified, this option defaults to 0x7C0.
segment.target: If not specified, this option defaults to 0x7C0.

segment.source: Specifies the location of the files that you intend to build into an .iso image.
segment.target: Specifies the location of the files that you intend to build into an .iso image.

segment.source: Specifies the name of the .iso image file.
segment.target: Specifies the name of the .iso image file.

segment.source: Optimization options can be used to optimize storage by encoding duplicate files only once.
segment.target: Optimization options can be used to optimize storage by encoding duplicate files only once.

segment.source: Uses a MD5 hashing algorithm to compare files.
segment.target: Uses a MD5 hashing algorithm to compare files.

segment.source: Uses a binary comparison of each file, and is slower than the -o option.
segment.target: Uses a binary comparison of each file, and is slower than the -o option.

segment.source: Ignores Diamond compression timestamps when comparing files.
segment.target: Ignores Diamond compression timestamps when comparing files.

segment.source: Order options specify the file order on disk.
segment.target: Order options specify the file order on disk.

segment.source: The file order does not have to list all files.
segment.target: The file order does not have to list all files.

segment.source: Any files that do not appear in this file are ordered as they would be ordinarily (that is, if the ordering file did not exist).
segment.target: Any files that do not appear in this file are ordered as they would be ordinarily (that is, if the ordering file did not exist).

segment.source: For more information, see Specify the boot order.
segment.target: For more information, see Specify the boot order.

segment.source: The -yo option takes precedence over the -y5 option.
segment.target: The -yo option takes precedence over the -y5 option.

segment.source: This option writes all files in an i386 directory first and in reverse sort order.
segment.target: This option writes all files in an i386 directory first and in reverse sort order.

segment.source: Specifies a text file that has a layout for the files to be put in the image.
segment.target: Specifies a text file that has a layout for the files to be put in the image.

segment.source: The DVD video and audio disk creation options cannot be combined with ISO 9660, Joliet, or UDF options.
segment.target: The DVD video and audio disk creation options cannot be combined with ISO 9660, Joliet, or UDF options.

segment.source: Truncates the ISO 9660 section of the image during DVD video and audio disk creation.
segment.target: Truncates the ISO 9660 section of the image during DVD video and audio disk creation.

segment.source: When this option is used, only the VIDEO_TS, AUDIO_TS, and JACKET_P directories are visible from the ISO 9660 file system.
segment.target: When this option is used, only the VIDEO_TS, AUDIO_TS, and JACKET_P directories are visible from the ISO 9660 file system.

segment.source: Specifies UDF Video Zone compatibility during DVD video and audio disk creation.
segment.target: Specifies UDF Video Zone compatibility during DVD video and audio disk creation.

segment.source: During creation, UDF 1.02 and ISO 9660 are written to the disk.
segment.target: During creation, UDF 1.02 and ISO 9660 are written to the disk.

segment.source: All files in the VIDEO_TS, AUDIO_TS, and JACKET_P directories are written first.
segment.target: All files in the VIDEO_TS, AUDIO_TS, and JACKET_P directories are written first.

segment.source: These directories take precedence over all other ordering rules that are used for this image.
segment.target: These directories take precedence over all other ordering rules that are used for this image.

segment.source: Messaging options customize how file and directory information appears.
segment.target: Messaging options customize how file and directory information appears.

segment.source: Displays the allocation summary for files and directories.
segment.target: Displays the allocation summary for files and directories.

segment.source: Shows duplicate files when the system creates the image.
segment.target: Shows duplicate files when the system creates the image.

segment.source: Reports all file names or directories that are not ISO-compliant or Joliet-compliant.
segment.target: Reports all file names or directories that are not ISO-compliant or Joliet-compliant.

segment.source: Reports all file names that are not DOS-compliant.
segment.target: Reports all file names that are not DOS-compliant.

segment.source: Reports each file name that is copied to the image.
segment.target: Reports each file name that is copied to the image.

segment.source: Suppresses warnings for non-identical files that have the same initial 64,000 bytes.
segment.target: Suppresses warnings for non-identical files that have the same initial 64,000 bytes.

segment.source: General image creation options can be used together with a single-boot entry option or multi-boot entry options to create bootable CD or DVD images.
segment.target: General image creation options can be used together with a single-boot entry option or multi-boot entry options to create bootable CD or DVD images.

segment.source: For more information, see Boot Options and Examples.
segment.target: For more information, see Boot Options and Examples.

segment.source: The -m and -maxsize options cannot be used together.
segment.target: The -m and -maxsize options cannot be used together.

segment.source: Specifies that the system must use ANSI file names instead of OEM file names.
segment.target: Specifies that the system must use ANSI file names instead of OEM file names.

segment.source: Encodes time values as Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) for all files, instead of the local time.
segment.target: Encodes time values as Universal Coordinated Time (UCT) for all files, instead of the local time.

segment.source: Includes hidden files and directories in the source path of the image.
segment.target: Includes hidden files and directories in the source path of the image.

segment.source: Creates an image even if some of the source files cannot be opened.
segment.target: Creates an image even if some of the source files cannot be opened.

segment.source: Ignores the maximum size limit of an image.
segment.target: Ignores the maximum size limit of an image.

segment.source: Overrides the default maximum size of an image.
segment.target: Overrides the default maximum size of an image.

segment.source: The default value is a 74-minute CD.
segment.target: The default value is a 74-minute CD.

segment.source: However, if UDF is used, the default has no maximum size.
segment.target: However, if UDF is used, the default has no maximum size.

segment.source: where 4096 limits the image to 4096 MB.
segment.target: where 4096 limits the image to 4096 MB.

segment.source: This option does not create an image.
segment.target: This option does not create an image.

segment.source: Resolves symbolic links to their target location.
segment.target: Resolves symbolic links to their target location.

segment.source: Specifies the timestamp for all files and directories.
segment.target: Specifies the timestamp for all files and directories.

segment.source: You can use any delimiter between the items.
segment.target: You can use any delimiter between the items.

segment.source: Specifies that directory records must be exactly aligned at the end of sectors.
segment.target: Specifies that directory records must be exactly aligned at the end of sectors.

segment.source: Opens source files that have write sharing.
segment.target: Opens source files that have write sharing.

segment.source: These examples illustrate how to do the following:
segment.target: These examples illustrate how to do the following:

segment.source: Create a bootable CD or DVD for a UEFI-based computer by using a single-boot entry.
segment.target: Create a bootable CD or DVD for a UEFI-based computer by using a single-boot entry.

segment.source: Create a bootable CD or DVD for a UEFI-based or BIOS-based computer by using a multi-boot entry.
segment.target: Create a bootable CD or DVD for a UEFI-based or BIOS-based computer by using a multi-boot entry.

segment.source: Specify the boot file order on a disk.
segment.target: Specify the boot file order on a disk.

segment.source: Use a single-boot entry to create a bootable image
segment.target: Use a single-boot entry to create a bootable image

segment.source: You can use the Oscdimg tool to create a bootable CD or DVD by using a single-boot entry.
segment.target: You can use the Oscdimg tool to create a bootable CD or DVD by using a single-boot entry.

segment.source: Create an image file for a UEFI-based computer.
segment.target: Create an image file for a UEFI-based computer.

segment.source: where C:winpeamd64media is the location of the source files, and C:winpeamd64winpeamd64.iso is the path of the .iso file.
segment.target: where C:winpeamd64media is the location of the source files, and C:winpeamd64winpeamd64.iso is the path of the .iso file.

segment.source: Use multi-boot entries to create a bootable image
segment.target: Use multi-boot entries to create a bootable image

segment.source: You can use the Oscdimg tool to create a bootable CD or DVD by using multi-boot entries.
segment.target: You can use the Oscdimg tool to create a bootable CD or DVD by using multi-boot entries.

segment.source: When you do this, note the following:
segment.target: When you do this, note the following:

segment.source: The bootdata option must be followed by the number of boot entries in the command (-bootdata:number).
segment.target: The bootdata option must be followed by the number of boot entries in the command (-bootdata:number).

segment.source: Each multi-boot entry must be delimited by using a hash symbol ().
segment.target: Each multi-boot entry must be delimited by using a hash symbol ().

segment.source: Each option for a boot entry must be delimited by using a comma (,).
segment.target: Each option for a boot entry must be delimited by using a comma (,).

segment.source: Each boot entry must specify the platform ID.
segment.target: Each boot entry must specify the platform ID.

segment.source: Create an image file for either a UEFI-based or BIOS-based computer by using a multi-boot command.
segment.target: Create an image file for either a UEFI-based or BIOS-based computer by using a multi-boot command.

segment.source: where this command starts the Etfsboot.com boot file for a BIOS image, and then starts the Efisys.bin boot file for a UEFI image.
segment.target: where this command starts the Etfsboot.com boot file for a BIOS image, and then starts the Efisys.bin boot file for a UEFI image.

segment.source: For images larger than 4.5 GB, you must create a boot order file to make sure that boot files are located at the beginning of the image.
segment.target: For images larger than 4.5 GB, you must create a boot order file to make sure that boot files are located at the beginning of the image.

segment.source: The rules for file ordering are as follows:
segment.target: The rules for file ordering are as follows:

segment.source: The order file must be in ANSI.
segment.target: The order file must be in ANSI.

segment.source: The order file must end in a new line.
segment.target: The order file must end in a new line.

segment.source: The order file must have one file per line.
segment.target: The order file must have one file per line.

segment.source: Each file must be specified relative to the root of the image.
segment.target: Each file must be specified relative to the root of the image.

segment.source: Each file must be specified as a long file name.
segment.target: Each file must be specified as a long file name.

segment.source: Each file path cannot be longer than MAXPATH.
segment.target: Each file path cannot be longer than MAXPATH.

segment.source: For example, D:cdimage would resemble the following (where D is the drive letter of the DVD drive):
segment.target: For example, D:cdimage would resemble the following (where D is the drive letter of the DVD drive):

segment.source: To create a boot order file
segment.target: To create a boot order file

segment.source: where BootOrder.txt contains the following list of files:
segment.target: where BootOrder.txt contains the following list of files:
